root.title: Doloodoyn stele and inscription, The
root.history: The inscription belongs to Kirghiz state epoch. The text of the inscription is very similar to Yenissey inscriptions.
root.place: The stele was found in Har Us district of Turgen sum of Uvs aimag of Mongolia.
root.store: The stele is moved to the local history museum of Ulaangom sum of Uvs aimag.
root.general: The stele was in a big barrow (a circle – 17.5 m). The stele is made from granite of red-brown color.
root.description: The inscription consists of 4 lines. The lines consist of 68 symbols and similar to Yenissey writings. But about 30 of symbols are invisible.
root.size: Height of symbols is 7.5-8 cm, width is 6.9-7.1 cm, depth is 0.1-0.2 cm. Length of the first line (D-1) approximately is 105 cm, the second line length (D-2) is 102 cm, the third line (D-3) length is 103 cm, the fourth line (D-4) length is 102 cm.
root.investigation: Mongolian archeologist T.Dorzhsuren 251 found in 1955. No solid research of the inscription was conducted yet.
root.details: Н.Базылхан "Көне түрік бітіктастары мен ескерткіштері (Орхон, Ениесей, Талас)" //"Қазақстан тарихы түркі тілді деректемелерде" атты сериясы бойынша. II том. - Алматы: Дайк-пресс, 2005. - Б.160-161.
